## Step 0: a catchy `r emo::ji("package")` name

--

`available::available()` makes sure that the package name is valid and available.

--

## Step 4: write functions

```r
usethis::use_r(name = "zomato-api")
```

```r
● Modify 'zomato-api.R'
```

An API key is needed, which you can sign up [here](https://developers.zomato.com/api).

We are going to write some Zomato API wrappers. Check out [the documentation](https://developers.zomato.com/documentation) for developers.

---

## Write functions in interactive session

```r
library(httr)
library(jsonlite)
zomato_search <- function(api_key = NULL, query) {
  # URL to Zomato API
  url <- modify_url(
    url = "https://developers.zomato.com" , 
    path = "/api/v2.1/search"
  )
  # request URL
  resp <- GET(
    url = url, 
    config = add_headers("user-key" = api_key),
    query = list(q = query)
  )
  # read the JSON file
  parsed <- fromJSON(
    content(
      resp, as = "text", type = "application/json", encoding = "UTF-8"
    ),
    flatten = TRUE
  )
  # return results
  parsed$restaurants
}

ur_key <- "your-api-key"
zomato_search(ur_key, query = "Brother Budan Baba Melbourne")
```

## Step 7: document your functions

* Shortcut `command` + `option` + `shift` + `R` to insert roxygen skeleton

* Shortcut `command` + `shift` + `D` to generate man file (`*.Rd`)

